item.title: Lost Treasures & Dragon Roofs: Remembering the Imperial Palace Hotel & Casino's Unique V Neck Era in Vintage Las Vegas
item.description:
A Palace Rises on the Strip

For decades, the Imperial Palace Hotel and Casino stood as a distinct landmark on the Las Vegas Strip. Its journey began far more humbly as the Flamingo Capri motel, but a visionary purchase by Ralph Engelstad in the early 1970s set it on a path to becoming a uniquely themed destination. Engelstadâ€™s concept, realized through the design talents of Merlin J. Barth, wasn’t just about creating a casino; it was about transporting guests to an imagined ancient Chinese palace.
